text: Lineage - specific activation of <extra_id_0> STAT3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by <extra_id_0> interferon-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in human neutrophils .

Binding of <extra_id_0> interferon-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) to its heterodimeric receptor induces activation of the tyrosine kinases <extra_id_0> JAK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> JAK2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> followed by tyrosine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> STAT1alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Selective activation of <extra_id_0> STAT1alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> at the <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> receptor is achieved by specific interaction between a cytosolic tyrosine motif including Y440 in the <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma receptor alpha-chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the SH2 domain of <extra_id_0> STAT1alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

We demonstrate that , in addition to <extra_id_0> STAT1alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> STAT3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is also activated by <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in human neutrophils .

The activation of <extra_id_0> STAT3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was not found in human eosinophils , monocytes , and HL-60 cells , although the <extra_id_0> STAT3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein was expressed in these cells .

The cell type - specific activation of <extra_id_0> STAT3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was also observed in neutrophils that are differentiated in vitro from human <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + hematopoietic stem cells .
These results indicate that a single cytokine receptor can activate different STAT family members in a cell - specific manner , which might result in cell - specific gene transcription .
